data.title: Loading states are not synced between players.
data.body:
While gen1 loads almost instantly, gen2 does not and I've seen it enough times that a player only arrives to a game when another has already timed out from it.

Reloading usually turns out successful, implying that terrain loading (#11419) is a particularly heavy toll on loadtimes. It would still be better if these would be somehow synced between the players to prevent these cases.

data.title: Tileset textures are never unloaded from VRAM.
data.body:
They are cached instead. This works great with gen1, but gen2 mods (for example, Yuri's Revenge with it's 5+1 (lunar was underutilized afterall) terrains all starting on 4096 sheetsizes (even RA2 temperate has 4096) end up a major danger to VRAM utilization.

This, along with #11359 will cause a lot of problems if mods with custom terrain (D-Day, Twisted Insurrection, Project Phantom) decide to give a try at porting over.

data.title: Diplomacy out?
data.body: Edit: Removed by author request

data.title: Add naive capturing to HackyAI
data.body:
Currently only RA's Rush AI is setup in a testable manner.

This PR adds these fields to `HackyAIInfo`:

``` csharp
[Desc("Actor types that can capture other actors (via `Captures` or `ExternalCaptures`).",
    "Leave this empty to disable capturing.")]
public HashSet<string> CapturingActorTypes = new HashSet<string>();

[Desc("Actor types that can be targeted for capturing.",
      "Leave this empty to include all actors.")]
public HashSet<string> CapturableActorTypes = new HashSet<string>();

[Desc("Minimum delay (in ticks) between trying to capture with CapturingActorTypes.")]
public readonly int MinimumCaptureDelay = 50;

[Desc("Maximum number of options to consider for capturing.")]
public readonly int MaximumCaptureTargetOptions = 5;

[Desc("Should visibility (Shroud, Fog, Cloak, etc) be considered when searching for capturable targets?")]
public readonly bool CheckCaptureTargetsForVisibility = true;
```

`CheckCaptureTargetsForVisibility` defaulting to `true` means exploration must happen before any of this new code has any noticeable effect, should `false` be a better default value I have no objections to changing it.

@obrakmann made the statement:

>  instead of the *CaptureTargetOptions, I'd have a list of actor types that are suitable for capturing

This is fair, I can implement this once this PR gets some initial review going.

Here is a series of images from a test game where the orange AI captured a conyard and built off of it before the original owner captured it back:

![screen shot 2016-06-07 at 1 35 53 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4861023/15877011/b9fc5d42-2cd6-11e6-9eef-19e7e375568e.png)
![screen shot 2016-06-07 at 1 35 58 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4861023/15877012/b9fce550-2cd6-11e6-9a63-049693eb94e0.png)
![screen shot 2016-06-07 at 1 36 11 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4861023/15877010/b9fb92fe-2cd6-11e6-8027-84e75991eb03.png)

I am leaving the commits as they are for the initial reviews, they will be squashed and fixed up as necessary if this goes anywhere.

data.title: TD/RA Tanya/Commando/Engineer Building entry.
data.body: Is there a way for the units Tanya, Commando, Engineer (TD) to have them enter into only part of the building instead of the center? This would help prevent the units being crushed which are not standing on the tile as they do the entry animations.

data.title: TD Obelisk Charge Idea
data.body:
Is there a way to implement a mechanic that after the Obelisk has fully charged up for a shot that it can retain its charge for five seconds?

This would allow it to have another chance to fire its shot off instead of having to recharge the shot after the unit has died without using my idea for the Obelisk balance.

Obelisk Initial Charge Delay reduced to 1 from 50.

Obelisk Reload Delay increase to 75 from 40. (Requires more testing.) 

An idea that Pchote has explained is a charge decay which I personally like a lot too. Instead of holding a five second charge the charge would decay slowly instead at the same rate as the charge up for the Obelisk. Which would also prevent the complete charge rest. Personally, this idea I like a lot more.

data.title: The scroll position is not reset when the earnings graph tab is selected
data.body:
(release-20160508)
On this gif I go down the list of the players and then I select the earnings graph tab.
The view is "stuck" at the bottom so I use my mouse wheel and it returns to the top.

![statistics view stuck](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/15838289/80d853d4-2c3d-11e6-96ca-b4cddd113306.gif)

data.title: Sort the support powers countdowns
data.body:
It's a feature request.
As a spectator you can't instantly know "who will launch the next atom bomb" when there are many players in a game, so it could be useful to sort the countdowns from the lowest to the highest.
It could be useful for the players too.

![many support powers](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/15837726/bebcad56-2c3a-11e6-899a-96000b8d836e.png)

data.title: Support power countdown as a link to the building
data.body:
It's a feature request.
When you are a spectator in a game with many players you may see many support powers at the same time and you don't necessarily know where the missile silos or iron curtains are built.
It could be useful to have the screen centered on the concerned building when you click on a countdown.
Here when I click on "Atom Bomb 1:17" the screen could be centered on the missile silo.
This feature could also be useful as a player in order to go directly to a sensitive building of your team.

![many support powers](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/15837429/8c5e0f90-2c39-11e6-987e-c55466545bbe.png)

data.title: Change RA flak truck to use flak explosion animation vs ground targets
data.body: The RA2 flak truck used the black flak explosion animation in the air and on the ground. Probably doesn't make loads of sense realistically but currently the flak explosion is barely seen in game due to the size of air units. Seems a waste to reuse a default explosion for hitting ground units when this animation exists.

data.title: Fix possible NREs in RenderAsync in VoxelRenderer.cs
data.body:
Detected by Coverity.

[`MatrixInverse`](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/Util.cs#L318) might return `null` for `invCameraTransform` which will then crash in [`MatrixVectorMultiply`](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/Util.cs#L194).

data.title: Mechanic for Chem troop + grenadier crush damage
data.body: The addition of a mechanic that damaged vehicles for crushing the Chem troopers or grenadiers would be beneficial to TD balancing as well as adding some more features.

data.title: V2s and barrels can now ignite trees
data.body:
Minor addition to #11377

Noticeable on Monster Tank Madness intro.

data.title: Various TS infantry fixes
data.body:
- fixed zapped animation colors
- cut down a lot of redundancy in sequences (I recommend looking at the full file, not just the diff)
- implemented TS-style Cyborg death explosions
- fixed crippled cyborgs returning to full speed once regaining health

The last remaining bit to make cyborgs work like in TS would be to play an explosion on the normal -> crippled transition, but I need more time to come up with something non-hacky.

data.title: Added an error message when setting up upgrades without UpgradeManager
data.body: A major downside from actor upgrades is that they can be setup in ways where nothing happens and you don't get any feedback why. This should help reduce the annoyance. Split from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11405.

data.title: Added burning trees to Tiberian Sun
data.body:
I went a different direction compared to Red Alert and Tiberian Dawn, because Tiberian Sun doesn't seem to have tree husks. So here nothing is really damaged or killed. Instead a decorational overlay is enabled via the upgrade system that wears off after some time. The benefit is that this allows per tree offsets and sequences.

It turned out to be very fiddly and I was very annoyed that it didn't work. I finally found out that `UpgradeManager` is missing for trees when I added a `TimedUpgradeBar` for debugging purposes which requires `UpgradeManager` and added a violent, but helpful crash. Added something similar to all optionally upgradeable traits.

data.title: Fix NREs in LobbyUtils.GetExternalIP
data.body:
Fixes #11246.

You can verify this by applying this commit directly on top of the last release and watching [this replay](http://www.gamereplays.org/openra/replays.php?game=92&show=details&id=311903). The crash happens when you mouse over a player name in the score screen.

The actual cause is that `orderManager.LocalClient` was null. The other check is just for safety's sake.

data.title: Improved map import for singleplayer missions
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9535.
Resolves the file not found errors: http://www.ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?p=545317#545317

data.title: crash/game can't open
Building was inherited by this yaml
data.body:
Inner Exception of type `OpenRA.YamlException`: <no filename available>:1632: Parent type `^Building` was already inherited by this yaml tree at <no filename available>:1446 (note: may be from a derived tree)

I have no idea where this comes from (I tried to track it), no idea where this came from. Anyone else ever encounter this?

Specifically, I try to remove a ~!structures.country function (removing the unique version of the building as well) and this exception results.

data.title: Resize TD mission browser
data.body:
Fixes #11388.

I checked that the title "Restore GDI Presence Near Salzburg" fits.

I also finally added the map numbers to the mission titles.

data.title: Added INotifyBurstComplete interface
data.body: Resurrected version of #11158, with the requested rename included. The original PR already had three :+1:s, so I'm gonna carry the +2 label over.

data.title: Add Moebius, Chan and Delphi to TD
data.body:
Also used the opportunity to clean up civilian sequences and fix voices.

Closes #11387.

data.title: Speed up sync by only syncing projectiles
data.body:
This improves CPU performance on a Thinkpad X230 from an average 12,4 ms at commit 910d04f (red) to 11,3 ms with this pull request (green) measured over 1000 ticks at the Red Alert shellmap with #10133.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/15801196/819eb4e0-2a8d-11e6-9d55-f497e0cd2a9f.png)

When I wrote https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3741 we were hunting weapon desyncs and syncing everything including decorations was just a side effect, because the engine didn't differentiate properly.

data.title: Set yaml filename when loading from FileSystem.
data.body: This fixes the generally unhelpful `OpenRA.YamlException: <no filename available>` exception messages that I accidentally broke with the filesystem rework.

data.title: Restricted effect rendering to the viewport
data.body: Another take on https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9443 after https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9699 grew way too complex and error prone.

data.title: Fixed air unit resupply
data.body:
Correction to the resupply queue for airplanes and helicopters.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VSiwaujBaPA

Fixes  #5966.

data.title: Added the FLAMEGUY death animation
data.body: A revival of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9350.
